docs.text: Introduction Secure Shell terminal access The SSH protocol is a secure and ubiquitous way of accessing remote services either using a terminal or X forwarded GUI sessions. It is an extremely mature connection technology which during the past 20 years have experienced only a few high profiled security vulnerabilities. The recent inclusion of openssh into the default installation of new windows versions is a testament to its maturity, reliability and wide-spread acceptance as a connection protocol. Furthermore, it is even believed to resist future quantum computing attacks from version 9.0.
docs.title: Home
